alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 03 at 2:10PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN KIT CARSON COUNTY THROUGH 245 PM MDT... At 209 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Stratton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Burlington around 225 PM MDT. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 423 and 440. Highway 385 between mile markers 178 and 193. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM MDT for east central Colorado.
